channel.title: Empire Total War in Win7
channel.description:
So I got ETW today from EB Games and after slowly downloading the forced steam update I tried to run the game, when I get to the menu its just glitching to the extreme, flashing to loads screen and menu's overlap and stay when I go to other menu's.
I took a screenshot but fraps and printscreen both showed up blank white images.
I managed to navigate though and start up a quick mission but when loading it was going through the load bar it constantly flashed back to the desktop, back to the load screen and so on till it finished, which took very long.
Once it was loaded, the game wasn't much better, very slow and stuttered, along with geometric glitches (remember the picture of HL2 metro cop I posted a while ago, but not as bad).
I tired going to from Pixel Shader 3 to 2 but no avail.
I'm on build 7127. PC specs aren't needed, they well surpass the recommended ones. I'm also using the latest drivers for my vid card.
I scoured google but no results thats I can find match my same problems.

item.title: Empire Total War in Win7
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
Like I said, I’ve heard about it many times.

But It’s not implemented in the Build I use.

:facepalm:

Read full topic

item.title: Empire Total War in Win7
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
I also heard about that, but I haven’t found anything like it yet.

But, recently Build 7600 popped up in torrents, so when I get the chance, I’ll try getting that one and seeing if it has it.

In the mean time, I might just buy a new SATA HDD and dual boot XP.

Read full topic

item.description:
Yeah, your right there is. But thats only in the newer ones, I.E The RC builds rather than Beta builds.

item.description:
Isn’t there a thing in Win7 where it runs a version of XP in a VM for stuff like this? I seem to recall hearing something about that recently.

item.title: Empire Total War in Win7

item.description:

item.title: Empire Total War in Win7
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
Level:

Windows 7 isn’t released yet, so it’s not supported. Your best bet is using a supported OS.

STFU and get out.

I wanted help not fags telling me what I’ve heard a million times before.

And P-Thunder, I always forget that, gonna try now.

EDIT: Compatibility for XP SP2, 3 and Vista SP 1, 2 all do the same thing.

Read full topic

item.description:
Tried compatbility options within the .exe?

Is that the version that supports good windows XP emulating and such?
